content.question:
The position of a particle at any time t  ≥ 0 is given by x(t) = t2 − 3 and y(t) = 2/3 t3.

(a) Find the magnitude of the velocity vector at t = 5.

frqParts.text:
The position of a particle at any time t  ≥ 0 is given by x(t) = t2 − 3 and y(t) = 2/3 t3.

(a) Find the magnitude of the velocity vector at t = 5.
(b) Find the total distance traveled by the particle from t = 0 to t = 5.
(c) Find dy/dx as a function of x.

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
